variant.title: INVITED LECTURE Narrative Summarization
variant.author: Inderjeet MANI
variant.affiliation: Department of Linguistics, ICC 452 Georgetown University
variant.bodyText: 37th and O Street Washington, DC 20057 USA im5@georgetown.edu

The understanding and summarization of stories remains a challenge, in part because of the inability to adequately capture the ‘aboutness’ of information content. This can result in inappropriate content selection as well as summary incoherence. This talk sketches a general framework for narrative summarization that relies in part on exploitation of temporal information. I will show how this framework can help address the above problems. I go on to discuss how different levels of narrative structure can provide useful information for summarization.
